item.description:
The Harvard Gilbert & Sullivan Players are performing one of G & S 's best known comic operas this fall--HMS Pinafore. It tells the story of a captain's daughter who falls in love with a lowly sailor...and then everything goes 'topsy turvy'.

Bonus nerd points to those who can identify the following quote.

"You can always count on Gilbert and Sullivan for a rousing finale full of sound and fury and signifying absolutely nothing" 

Cost: $15 for adults; $10 students; $5 for Harvard students. All tickets are for reserved seating.

Pre-show Dinner: If you are interested in having a bite to eat before the show, we'll be meeting in the food court of the Garage at 6:30. We'll also head out somewhere for drinks/munchies after the show.

Otherwise,  tickets can be purchased online at https://www.boxoffice.harvard.edu/Online/mapSelect.asp. Please note that there's an additional service fee of $3 per ticket and $5 per transaction.

Tickets can also be purchased in person at the Harvard Box Office.  The box office is located inside the Holyoke Center Arcade (next to Au bon Pain) in Harvard Square--1350 Massachusetts Avenue Cambridge, MA 02138.  The hours are:  Tuesday-Sunday, 12:00-6:00 pm.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet inside the lobby of the Agassiz Theater
item.name: Gilbert and Sullivan's HMS Pinafore at Harvard
